intro: Loeselia glandulosa var. scabra, commonly known as the rough-stemmed loeselia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
